method.name: PUT
method.doc: The LMI uses a two-stage commit process when you make changes to the appliance.
Stage 1: Changes are made by using the LMI and saved to a staging area.
Stage 2: The user explicitly deploys the changes into production.

Multiple changes can exist in a pending state at the same time. They are committed or rolled back together when a user deploys or rolls back these changes. Any changes that affect running reverse proxy instances require a restart of the effected instances before the changes can take effect.
Certain appliance updates require either the appliance or the web server to be restarted before the changes can take effect. When one or more of these updates are made alongside other reverse proxy updates, an additional step is required to deploy the reverse proxy updates. You must:
Deploy all updates.
Restart the appliance or the web server.
Deploy all remaining updates. If there are conflicts between the pending changes and the production files, then all pending changes are automatically rolled back and the production files remain unchanged.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: result
param.doc: The result of the operation (0 for success, or 1 for a failure)

param.name: status
param.doc: A status code for the result. The status code is a bitmask indicating if the deployment operation succeeded and if any additional action is needed for the changes to take affect. The options are: 0 - successful; 1: failure; 2: an appliance restart is required; 4: an LMI restart is required; 8: an LMI restart is required; 16: either web reverse proxy or authorization server instances now require a restart (the message will indicate the instance names); 32: the runtime profile was restarted as a result of the operation; 64: the runtime profile failed to restart; 128: a runtime profile restart is required; 256: the runtime profile was reloaded as a result of the operation; 512: the runtime profile failed to reload; 1024: a runtime profile reload is required.

param.name: message
param.doc: A text description of the result of the operation.

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.
An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.
